item.title: Crispy Southwest Eggrolls: Building Layers of Flavor and Texture
item.description: A guide to making shatteringly crisp southwest eggrolls at home using precise moisture control, proper oil temperature, and a balanced filling. Learn the cooking science behind wrapper texture, filling stability, and deep frying technique that produces restaurant-quality results.
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 15 minutes

â° Total Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 12

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup (140g) cooked chicken, shredded â€” rotisserie chicken, leftover roasted, or poached
  • 1/2 cup (85g) black beans, canned, rinsed and thoroughly drained
  • 1/2 cup (75g) corn kernels â€” frozen and thawed, or fresh corn cut from cob
  • 1/2 cup (55g) sharp cheddar cheese, shredded from block (not pre-shredded)
  • 1/4 cup (40g) red bell pepper, finely diced â€” about 1/4 of a medium pepper
  • 2 tablespoons green onions, thinly sliced â€” white and light green parts only
  • 1 teaspoon (2g) chili powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon (1g) ground cumin
  • 1/4 teaspoon (0.5g) garlic powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon (1.5g) fine sea salt
  • 1/8 teaspoon (0.3g) black pepper
  • 12 eggroll wrappers â€” refrigerated section, not frozen, approximately 3.5 inches square
  • 2 cups (480ml) vegetable or canola oil for frying â€” high smoke point neutral oils only
  • Water for sealing

media:content.media:description: A guide to making shatteringly crisp southwest eggrolls at home using precise moisture control, proper oil temperature, and a balanced filling. Learn the cooking science behind wrapper texture, filling stability, and deep frying technique that produces restaurant-quality results.
